intro: Salsola hartmannii, commonly known as Hartmann's saltbush, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent, salt-tolerant leaves. The plant is often found growing in saline soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its growth habit is typically low and sprawling, forming dense mats that help stabilize soil in harsh environments. Salsola hartmannii plays a role in desert ecosystems by providing habitat and forage for various desert animals.
